english: Yes, he's also invited to the party.
arabic: آه، حْتى هُوَّ معْروض لْ الحفْلة.

english: I will also be present at the conference next week.
arabic: حْتى آنا غنْكون حاضر لْ المُؤْتمر السّيمانة الجايّة.

english: The stores will also be closing at six.
I want to go somewhere fun.
They’ve never been out of Morocco.
I usually go to work by car, but I sometimes walk.
arabic: الأغْلبية كنْمْشي للْخدمة بالطّنوْبيل، و لكِن بعْض المرّات كنتْمشّى.

english: I often see him at the café.
The cat somehow got in the house.
I haven’t finished my coffee yet.
It’s hot today. Let’s stay inside.
I like cats, but I don’t like dogs so much.
arabic: عْزيز عْلِيّا المْشاش، و لكِن ماعْزيزْش عْلِيّا الكْلاب بزّاف.

english: The apartment is on the fourth floor.
The gardener comes once a week.
to hang a picture on the wall
I love that painting hanging over the sofa.
arabic: عجْباتْني ديك التصْويرة لّي فوق الفُتوي.

english: to beat the dust out of a carpet
Could you turn off the light in the kitchen, please?
arabic: عفاك، تقْدر طْفي مْعاك الضَّوْ فْ الكوزينة؟

english: The power went out for an hour this afternoon.
arabic: تقْطع الضَّوْ ساعة كامْلة هاذ العْشية.

english: The only thing I want to do this evening is sit on the couch and watch TV.
arabic: الحاجة الوحيدة لّي باغي نْدير هاذ العْشية هِيَّ نْتّكّى فْ الفوتوي و نتْفرّج فْ التّلْفازة.

english: Dinner's ready! Come to the table!
Just put it in the microwave for two minutes.
arabic: غير ديرْها جوج دْقايْق فْ الميكْروأونْد.

english: to microwave, heat up in the microwave
I heated up the soup in the microwave.
double bed, queen bed, king bed
to sleep, fall asleep, go to sleep, go to bed
I only got four- or five-hours’ sleep last night.
arabic: نْعسْت غا شي ربْعة وْلا خمْسة دْيال السّْويْع البارح.

english: What time did you go to bed?
I was feeling sleepy, so I took a short nap.
arabic: حسّيت بْراسي فِيّا النّْعاس، و أنا نْعس واحد الشّْوية.

english: to be unable to get to sleep, have a restless night’s sleep
You don’t look like you slept well.
to be in a deep sleep
A loud noise woke me up.
I woke up at six o’clock in the morning.
to get up, get out of bed
I set my alarm for six in the morning.
arabic: عمّرْت لالرْم مْع السّْتة دْيال الصّْباح.

english: to dry off, towel oneself off
to take, get on/in (a bus, taxi, etc.)
to get off, get out of
I usually go to work by bus.
I take the metro every day.
The traffic is horrible right now!
Let’s not go downtown right now. It’s rush hour.
arabic: بْلا منْمْشيوْ لِلْمْدينة دابا، وَقْت الأُمْبوتِيّاج دابا.

english: to have the right of way
cross walk, pedestrian crossing (UK: zebra crossing)
You can just drop me off on the corner.
to give a lift to, take
Can you give me a ride home?
He never uses his turn signal.
I put the car in reverse and started backing up.
arabic: درْت مارْش آرْيار و بْديت كنْرْجع اللّوْر.

english: to speed, go over the speed limit
The police pulled me over for speeding.
to put on one’s seatbelt, wear one’s seat belt
There’s a dent in the side of the car!
arabic: كينا خبْطة فْ الجنْب دْيال الطُّنوْبيل!

english: Turn on your headlights when it starts to get dark.
arabic: شعّل الضّْواو مْني بْدا كيْضْلام الحال.

english: to get in an accident, have an accident
He crashed (his car) into a tree.
The car was totaled in the accident.
to take __ out of one’s pocket
What size shoes do you wear?
I’m not sure about my size.
to wear, to get dressed, to put on
What are you going to wear today?
He took a shower, got dressed, and left for work.
I think I need the next size up.
This shirt is wrinkled. I need to iron it.
a diamond ring, gold bracelet, and silver necklace
arabic: خاتم دْيامونْد، بْراسْلي دْيال الذّْهب، و سنْسْلة دْيال الفضّة

english: I have some relatives that live in New York.
How many children do you have?
My brother and my friend’s brother came with me.
arabic: جا مْعايا خويا و خو صاحْبي.

english: Do you have any brothers or sisters?
I have two older sisters and one younger brother.
arabic: عنْدي جوج خْواتات كْبار و خويا صْغيْر.

english: I’m the youngest in my family.
What do you feel like eating?
He took a bite of the hamburger and put it down.
arabic: خْدا عضّة من الهامْبورْڭر و حطّو.

english: She took a sip of water and put the glass down.
arabic: خْدات جُغْمة دْيال الما و حطّات الكاس.

english: I'm so thirsty. Could I have some water?
arabic: عطْشان بزّاف، تقْدر تعْطيني شْوية دْيال الما؟

english: Taste the soup. Does it need salt?
I don’t like how it tastes.
The milk is past its expiration date.
arabic: الحْليب فات تاريخ انْتِهاء الصّلاحية دْيالو.

english: – How does the soup taste? – It’s a little salty.
Potato chips are really bad for you.
If I feel hungry, I just have a small snack.
arabic: إلى جاني الجوع، كنْدير كسْكْروط صْغيْر.

english: Can I have a glass of water, please?
arabic: عفاك، تقْدر تعْطيني شي كاس دْ الما؟

english: There’s a can of cola in the fridge.
arabic: كينا واحد كانيْط كوكا فْ التّلّاجة.

english: How would you like your (Turkish) coffee?
Eat your ice cream before it melts.
Dark chocolate is better for you than milk chocolate.
arabic: الشّوكْلاط الكْحل حْسن ليك من الشّوكْلاط البْيَض.

english: I don’t feel like chicken. Let’s have beef.
arabic: ما فِيّا لّي ياكُل الدّْجاج، أجي ناخْدو البڭْري

english: This meat has a lot of fat on it.
arabic: هاذ اللّْحم فيه بزّاف دْ الشّحْمة.

english: to talk with one’s mouth full
Don’t talk with your mouth full!
Could you pass the salt, please?
I don’t feel well. I think I need to go see a doctor.
arabic: حاسّ بْراسي مْشي مزْيان، واقيلا خاصْني نمْشي عنْد الطّْبيب.

english: The doctor examined him and diagnosed him with the flu.
arabic: شافو الطّْبيب و لقا عنْدو ڭْريپ.

english: My shoulder has been hurting for ages.
I have a really bad headache.
to be congested, have nasal congestion
He broke his arm and has to wear a cast now.
arabic: هرّس إيدّو و دابا خاصّو يْدير الڭبْص.

english: to perform surgery on, operate on
to undergo surgery, have an operation
I’m going to the dentist’s to get a check-up and a cleaning.
arabic: غنْمْشي عنْد الدّونْتيسْت يْشوف لِيّا سْناني و نْدير ديطارْطْراج.

english: I need to practice speaking more.
You can’t understand anything he says.
I can speak a little Arabic.
I can get by in Arabic.
How do you pronounce this word?
Your Arabic pronunciation is quite good.
I need to work on my listening skills in Arabic.
arabic: خاصْني نخْدم عْلى السّمْع دْيالي فْ العرْبية.

english: to look up a word in the dictionary
Happy birthday and may you have many more!
arabic: عيد ميلاد سعيد! عُقْبال مْيةْ عام ان شاء الله!

english: He’s turning ten years old next week.

arabic: دِرْت ثْلاثين عام الشّْهر لّي فات.
تْزاديت فْألْف وْ تسْعمْية وْ تْمانين.

english: How did you work that out in your head? I need a calculator!
arabic: كيفاش تا حْسبْتيها فْراسك؟ آنا خاصْني كالْكيلاتْريس

english: Add up the price of all the items to get the total.
arabic: جْمع الثّمن دْيال ڭاع الحْوايْج باش تعْرف الطّوطال.

english: Subtract the smaller amount from the larger to find the difference.
arabic: نْقُص العدد الصّْغيْر من الكْبير باش تلْقى الفرْق.

english: Multiply the length and width to find the area of the rectangle.
arabic: ضْرب الطّول فْ العرْض باش تعْرف المِساحة دْيال المُسْتطيل.

english: Divide the total by the number of people to find the average.
arabic: قْسم الطّوطال عْلى عدد النّاس باش تعْرف لامْوايان.

english: Twenty divided by four equals five.
arabic: طْناش مقْسومة عْلى ربْعة كتْساوي خمْسة.

english: There are twenty books, and the twentieth book is mine.
arabic: كين عِشْرين كْتاب، و الكْتاب العِشْرين دْيالي.

english: Let’s go for a walk in the park.
We hung out at the shopping mall yesterday evening.
arabic: البارح فْ العْشية ضرْنا فْ الموْل.

english: I like to sit in a coffee shop and read the newspaper before I go to work.
arabic: كيْعْجبْني نْڭْلس فْ القهْوة و نقْرا جريدة قْبل ما نْمْشي الخدْمة.

english: What do you like to watch on TV?
I haven’t seen the second season of this show yet.
arabic: ماشفْتش السّيْزوْن الثّاني فْ هاذ السّيْري.

english: Have you ever been on TV?
There’s an interesting program on channel 3.
arabic: كايْن برْنامج زْوين فْ القناة تْلاتة.

english: I can’t hear what they’re saying. Could you turn the TV up a bit?
arabic: ماكنْسْمعْش آش كيْڭولو، واخّا تْزيد فْ الصّوْت شْوية؟

english: I’m trying to study. Could you turn the TV down a bit?
arabic: كنْحاول نْراجع. واخّا تنْقُص من الصّوْت شْوية؟

english: to rewind, go back to (the previous track)
Excuse me. Would you take a photo of us?
Let’s go to the cinema this weekend.
A new movie is coming out on Friday. Want to go?
arabic: فيلْم جْديد غيْخْرُج هاذ الجمْعة. تمْشي؟

english: They’re showing a classic movie this evening.
to sit close to the screen
I don’t like to sit too close to the screen.
What kind of movies do you like?
I love action movies, but I can’t stand romantic movies.
arabic: كيعجْبوني أفْلام أكْسْيون، و لكِن ماعنْديش مْع الأفْلام الرّومنْسية.

english: No, thank you. I don’t smoke.
What is the illiteracy rate in Morocco?
when I was in elementary school, ...
Her son is in first grade.
I’m studying Arabic at a language academy in Morocco.
arabic: كنْقْرى العرْبية فْواحد أكادِمية اللُّغات فْ المغْرِب.

english: in one’s second year of middle school
in one’s third year of high school
I have six classes a day.
Class starts at 8 o'clock and finishes at 9 o'clock.
arabic: الحِصّة كتْبْدا مْع الثْمنْية و كتْسالي مْع التّْسْعود.

english: to ask a question in class
Copy these sentences into your notebook.
We have a fifteen-minute break between classes.
arabic: عنْدْنا پوْز رْبُع ساعة مابيْن الحِصص.

english: He needs to study for the test.
The students have to write an essay about a historical event.
arabic: التّلاميذ خاصْهُم يِكتْبوا موْضوع عْلى حدث تاريخي.

english: I intend to enroll in an Arabic class next month.
arabic: مْعوّل نتْقيِّد فْكور دْالعرْبية الشّْهر الجاي.

english: to get into college, start university
I got into the faculty of medicine, but later I changed to law.
arabic: تقْبلْت فْجامِعة الطِّبّ، و لكِن من بعْد بدّلْت لْ القانون.

english: When did you graduate from university?
All the freshmen have to attend an orientation ceremony.
arabic: ڭاع لي پْرومْيِير أني خاصْهم يْحضْرو حِصّة التّعارُف.

english: He got a certificate for completing the course.
What was your favorite subject in school?
I really enjoyed studying history, but I hated science class.
arabic: كنْت كنْبْغي نقْرا التّاريخ، ولكِن مكنْتْش كانْحْمل الصّْيونْص.

english: She carried the box to the kitchen.
He picked the book up from the table.
I can’t express myself in Arabic very well.
to finish, come to an end; end, complete, accomplish
The ball is floating in the water.
I intend to succeed at my job.
He hasn’t moved in ten minutes.
He set down the book on the table.
The Titanic sank over a hundred years ago.
arabic: التّيتانيك غرْقات هاذي كْثر من مْية عام.

english: It’s below zero. It’s below freezing.
How hot does it get where you’re from?
Where I’m from, it doesn’t usually get over 30 degrees in the summer.
arabic: غالِبًا ماكتْفوتْش ثْلاثين درجة فْ الصّيْف فْ بْلادي.

english: It’s hotter than it was yesterday.
Does it snow where you’re from?
Where I’m from, it snows a lot in the winter.
arabic: كيْصُبّ الثّلْج بزّاف فْ الشّْتا فْ بْلادي.

english: There was a flash of lightning.
The thunder woke me up last night.
Do you think it’s going to rain?
It looks like (it’s going to) rain.
Marrakesh has a very arid climate.
She works in (the field of) teaching.
I work five days a week.
Have you found a job yet?
to finish work, get off work
I work eight hours a day.
to stay late at the office
to go on a business trip
I get paid on the first of the month.
I got a promotion this month.
I hope to retire when I’m sixty.
